newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Comalco sees full Boyne output in Q3.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Comalco sees full Boyne output in Q3.

text.p: Aliminium producer Comalco Ltd said on Wednesday the A$1 billion expansion of its half owned Boyne Island smelter was expected to be at full production by the third quarter of 1997.
Comalco chairman Leigh Clifford also told the annual meeting that the company was optimistic of maintaining the current improved performance throughout calendar 1997.

"I am pleased to report that on April 8 we started the first of the cells in the new number three production line at Boyne Island, well ahead of the orginally planned date of October," Clifford told the annual meeting.

"The expansion contains 264 cells and once we have the start up sequence running smoothly we will bring cells on line at the rate of two a day, we expect to have all cells operating at their specified capacity by the third quarter of this year."
The expansion would bring the smelters annual production capacity to 490,000 tonnes, making it the world's fourth largest smelter, Clifford said.
Comalco owns 50 percent of the existing Boyne Island smelter and has a 59.25 percent interest in the third production line.

Other partners in the Boyne Island expansion project are Mitsubishi Corp and Mitsubishi Materials Corp, which together holds 14.25 percent, Yoshida Kogyo KK, 9.5 percent and Sumitomo Corp, Sumitomo Light Metals Industries Ltd and Marubeni Corp, which collectively hold 17 percent.
Comalco is 67 percent-owned by RTZ Corp Plc-CRA Ltd.
